text: Hi guys, I got a HubDB with a datetime field. I can not get the output to format in the dutch language using the `|datetimeformat()` filter. I have set all my settings to Dutch in the sandbox environment, but I keep getting the date in English. `{{row.start_time|datetimeformat('%A %d %B')}}` This is the way I output the data.
Anyone knows if this is an issue or if I am doing something wrong?

Hi guys! Could you please, advise me. We're consideriing the idea of building new project- something like Instagram but for another purposes. Users can send photos and exchange information. All are registered users with HubSpot ID. And we are looking for some solution, some CMS, which could be either added to HubSpot or integrated or whatever, that would allow us to have all the information about the posts, images, comments of this or that specific user.Â So, we would be able to see when he posted, what he posted, whose post he commented and what was the comment. Something like this. Thank you.
why not use HubSpot CMS in combination with HubDB? this might not scale to a billion users but on the other hand you can built a minimum viable product to see if the idea even flies rather quickly
to be able to moderate posts. Can we integrate that via API? and update information about each specific post if needed..
can we somehow reduce this in HubSpot ??

So, in case we have Instagram-like project and all the users can post there their info. Just one thing- the posts have to be checked by the moderator before allowing this post to be published. So, there should be a way- ability to moderate the post. and in case everything is ok with post- it is on. And then we want to be able to check posts, who posted, and to check the contact- which posts were posted by him and to have the data the contact posted. and also the comments he left under the posts of other contacts. So, this could be arranged via HubSpot CMS plus HubDB?

Sorry, my exlanation sounds complicated. To put it simple:
we have application, where contacts make posts( text, image, video) and posts could be commented.  We want to synchronise such posts with HubSpot in this or that way, so our admin managers could moderate (approve or decline such posts) via HubSpot
large hubdb queries can tend to do that

Hey all - working on getting page speed optimized a bit for a client and noticing that the hs chatbot is really sucking up a lot of juice. Anyone have any tips or best practices for getting the chatbot to play nicely with google? <@U3T21PDBK> I feel like ive seen some posts way way back from you about something similar? Though I could be totally wrong :stuck_out_tongue:

If it is not a native hs chatbot, then you could <https://www.analyticsmania.com/post/google-tag-manager-impact-on-page-speed-and-how-to-improve/|manage it with GTM> or delay calling it until 3-6 seconds
It is most def the native one
Nop, I am not using hubD, just a simple page
